benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host back into rotation

covered: Successful host rotation when host is out of rotation (TC01)
Idempotent operation when host is already in rotation (TC02)
Unexpected payload is ignored and operation succeeds (TC07)
Unexpected headers are ignored and operation succeeds (TC08)
Performance under high load with acceptable timeout (TC10)
Regression test for previously fixed bug (TC11)
Security injection attempt in headers does not compromise the system (TC12)
Concurrent requests are handled without race conditions (TC14)
gaps: Non‑existing host resource handling – no test covers attempting to put a host that does not exist into rotation
Rate limiting / throttling – no test verifies how the API behaves under a burst of rapid requests
Server error handling (e.g., 500 Internal Server Error) – not covered
recommendations: Add a scenario that attempts to PUT a non‑existent host and expects a 404 or appropriate error code
Introduce a rate‑limiting test that sends many rapid requests and verifies the API returns 429 or similar
Include a test for unexpected server errors (e.g., 500) to ensure graceful degradation
Consider a test for partial updates or malformed payloads if the API ever accepts a body in the future
